hasVariant.name: Deploy Shovel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Deploy Shovel online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this concept. Keep the pieces together for speed and efficiency. Not my mainstay for winter camping, but amazing for quick and light touring.
review.name: Down with the Two-Part Shovel

review.reviewBody: It's nice not having to store two parts. Fits perfect in M cirque 22 ski vest. Makes it quicker to remove / use with one or two less steps of grabbing / attaching a handle. Love it.
review.name: Love Single Tool

review.reviewBody: Very compact but strong. Taller people might find it a bit short but easy and fast to “deploy”
review.name: Very compact but strong. Taller

review.reviewBody: I've had this shovel for around 3 years, and it works great. It packs down small, fits well in any bag, and is quick to put together. It's a bit small to use as anything but an avvy shovel, but it's fantastic for its intended purpose.
review.name: Fantastic!

review.reviewBody: Shovel was smaller than I expected but it’s nice for a small bag. Feels very durable and deploys very quickly
review.name: Compact and easy to use

review.reviewBody: Should have paid attention to the dimensions, it does what it is supposed to do but feels tiny for a big g fella like me.
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody: My only complaint is that it would be nice to have a longer handle.
review.name: Good shovel

review.reviewBody: Light and relatively easy to lash to the outside of my pack. One callout is the short handle makes for more work (I'm 6'2") but this is an acceptable trade-off for the shovel's size and weight.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: Great shovel, good price. Small but very effective, easy to carry and extend handle. High quality very durable.
review.name: Great shovel

review.reviewBody: Love how small and simple this shovel is. Not the smoothest to deploy with the little metal tabs being a little tricky to get out of the way.
review.name: Compact little shovel

name: Deploy Shovel

review.reviewBody: I feel bad giving only one star, but for me that's what it was. Nothing special, the fit was way off for me. Really cozy feel nevertheless. I have another similar OR pullover and I can say it regulates body heat while active very well (but fit is off again, in that the waist seems made for an "unfit man"). I like the pockets! But it just felt sort of under-engineered for the price.
review.name: Wanted to love it, but...

review.reviewBody: Light weight, pockets, great color what more can one ask for!
review.name: nICE!

review.reviewBody:
A nice light fleece, perfect for when you don't need a heavy sweater.  Great for hiking or whenever wear.

Chest pocket is great, but would be nice if the waist pockets had zippers.

Comfortable and great for layering.
I purchased this for my husband and he loves it. Very lightweight, but still keeps you warm. The chest pocket is his new favorite place to keep his phone
review.name: Great everyday pullover

review.reviewBody: Nice fleece. Not fully technical but breathable and comfortable while being able to pass for borderline smart casual. Like this for cool weather runs, travel, and just wearing around the house.
review.name: Nice flexible, casual fleece

review.reviewBody: It's casual, warm and really comfortable. Reminds me of my grid top I was issued in the USMC but more comfortable.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and functional. I love this pullover for around town or on the trail.
review.name: Warm and fits well.

review.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the fit and feel of the product. I ordered a medium based off the sizing chart and it was perfect. I went with the orange color and love it.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: cant beat a solid fleece sweater. worn in the living room just as much as taken to the mountains
review.name: cozy and fitted

review.reviewBody: Great pullover for all occasions. Easy to layer but warm by itself. Only thing I wasn't a fan of the color selection but still love all of my OR products
review.name: Great pullover

name: Trail Mix 1/4-Zip Pullover - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very light, and comfortable!
review.name: Danner Boots

review.reviewBody:
Take that title with a grain of salt. I've never been one to splurge on Boots, I've always opted for the cheaper versions since I go through Boots fairly quickly but I can tell you one thing I have no regrets splurging on these. They're one of the most comfortable Boots I've ever experienced in my life, lite as air almost feels like you're walking on clouds. I bought these for my third summit of Half Dome and the hike felt alot easier then the 2 other times I did it. Sturdy, fashionable, and lightweight, what's there not to love?! The grip on these baby's is insane and never once did I feel my feet getting hot or sweaty. 
I'll definitely be buying these boots over and over again throughout my life.
review.name: Best Boots I've Ever Bought

name: Mountain 600 Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Loved the color and style for MTB but after 30+ years of MTB and road racing, mostly sponsored, these are the worst socks I have every worn.  I wear a US 10.5 M and the XL are nearly impossible to get on.  They are too narrow and just trying to pull them on by pinching the material between my thumb and index finger (no nails) the material just came apart on the third use.  I seriously doubt I'll get more than 2 or 3 more rides in with them.  

I have at least 10 pairs of SockGuy, DeFeet and some other brands of cycling socks, some nearly 10 years old.  All "Large" and I've never torn one of them just trying to put it on.  

Not only can't I recommend these Castelli socks, I highly recommend you buy them only if you can get a size larger than they recommend - i.e. get XL if Castelli says you need M.  Don't even bother with them if you normally wear Large.  

All of Castelli's clothing is small.  I wear "L" in bibs but XL in Castelli and I just got their Perffetto Ros 2 jacket and it is amazing, but I also had to get a XL, while I've never worn anything other than a "L" in tops, bibs, jackets or vests.  They make some great stuff but it's always ridiculously small, and in the case of these socks, poorly made.
review.name: Way too small and easily ripped

review.reviewBody:
Riding in Tucson heat requires a thin, lightweight sock that not only wicks away sweat, but keeps your feet from more than minimal sweating to begin with. These fit the ball and they look great to boot.

A little tight when first putting them on. But not as bad after washing and putting on again. I hope they get even better now that I rode for over an hour in them. If so then they are 5* and I will change the rating.

Shoe size 46 ordered XXL socks. Deep Green and Defender Green colors.
review.name: Really good summer sock!

name: Superleggera 18 Sock

review.reviewBody: I bought the Primio because it would not interfere with my dropper post. I followed the description that outlined what it could hold. I tried to put my 29.5x 2.4 tube into the bag and it wouldn’t fit.  I didn’t even try to add tire levers or cartridges.  It would be a nice bag for 700x23-34 tubes perhaps. review.reviewBody: I have a couple pairs of Tevas but wanted to get a pair that were slightly "dressier" so I could wear on an upcoming trip to Europe and not feel weird going to restaurants etc wearing them. I bought these in the Tigers Eye color and think they're perfect for what I needed. I was worried about the fraying on the edges of the fabric, I though it might look too "rustic" in person but definitely not the case, you don't really even notice in person (it's not too pronounced.)
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

review.reviewBody: My first pair and I am pleased. They are adjustable and easy to put on to fit my feet. The straps are comfortable and I love the non slip bottom. I will buy another pair in a different color.
review.name: Pretty and Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Very cute and love the color. Got several compliments. Incredibly comfortable even when soaking wet. TTS. Would purchase again!
review.name: Cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: My daughter purchased these shoes for her European trip along with a pair of converse that are working great. The Teva's have started to delaminate on the soul at the toes. They are not holding up at all. It's only been one month into her trip, and they are falling apart. I notified Teva, and they stated the only way she could get a new pair is to return them, well, she is backpacking through Europe and other countries and not returning, till the spring. I thought Tera would be a company that would back their product and want to support travelers and young people. I am planning to visit her at the end of summer. I was hoping I'd bring her a new pair, but I will be looking to purchase something a different than a Teva since they didn't hold up to her travels and they were not supportive of their product.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: These are a Sandals are exactly what I was looking for. They are comfortable, stylish, and not flat to the floor. The adjustable fit ensures they don't cause any blisters. I am very happy and highly satisfied with these sandals.
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: Perfect shoe for me! I love the way it conforms to my foot with the adjustable velcro straps making for a great fit all around. I am a size 8 1/2, and the size 8 feels exactly right. Years ago I had bought a size 9, wore them for a while even though they were too big, and finally went back to buy the size 8 which fits much, much better. I can wear these shoes all day long without any discomfort. Love the style and the slight platform.
review.name: I will never be without these shoes

review.reviewBody: Bought these in Green and loved them so much I got another color! So comfortable and goes with so many looks (also waterproof!)
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: So glad I decided to splurge and buy these. They are the most comfortable sandal I've ever worn. I have a bad ankle from a sprain a couple years ago and finding a comfortable shoe/sandal has been difficult. These are the absolute best, I definitely will be wearing them all the time this summer. Walked around for 6+ hours at an amusement park yesterday and they were perfectly comfortable the whole time.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: These feel cheaply made and are uncomfortable just to wear on my feet without even walking. Even adjusted, the straps are digging into my feet. Unfortunately going to return.
review.name: Uncomfortable Cheap

review.reviewBody: I'd been debating getting Tevas for a while, I couldn't decide but I kept coming back to these. So far I love them. The color is lovely, they fit well and are comfortable. I wore them for about 5 hours (maybe longer) the first time I wore them and they only rubbed a little on one side of one foot. I expected this since they're brand new though. I imagine they'll break in pretty easily. I can't say how well they'll hold up in the long run but they seem to be good quality.
review.name: Glad I finally purchased these!

name: Midform Universal Canvas Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: beware the tight torso length, there were no posted measurements for torso length in this one piece.  I am 5 7 and 1/2  and 130, model is 5 8 and she is wearing a regular small.  I ordered regular small based on what model was and the torso is too short!  When I raise my hands up it rides the croch.  I hope the long will work but the advertising was misleading as someone taller than me was wearing the same size as me but the torso is too short.  It is very attractive I hope that mountain hardwear will include the torso length in specs going forward and honor an exchange

review.reviewBody: What can I say, it’s a metal hook in heavy gauge steel. That’s what you get. The tabs at the bottom help it find a stable placement, and the holes are good for tying your cord or webbing.
review.name: Hookin’ ain’t easy

review.reviewBody: Great medium size hook, got a pair and filed one to have a pointy tip
review.name: Cliffhanger

review.reviewBody: Used for work positioning on high rise buildings along with the normal twin ropes.    Used with Petzl Grillon to achieve an adjustable sideways anchor for detailed rope work, painting around window frames mostly, but we have aid climbed on two at a time as well.  This model grips the best as the knife edge is held in place by the directional pull and the talons hold the webbing off the wall but not too far so that they put an angular force on the edge.  BD Rocks, again.
review.name: Awesome kit!!!

name: Cliffhanger Hook

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I read some reviews said it runs small, so I ordered one size bigger but it's way too big, so I returned it and reordered my normal size, it fit just right. The rise is a little lower than I expected, but I like the 18" length that sit under the knees. I'm happy with the purchase and wish there will be more in bright colors. I'm 5'4", 103lbs, 25.5" nature waist, ordered size 2.
review.name: Ture to size

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They look great!  I got the XS first because I bought this size before, but this style runs small, I had to return and bought a size up.
review.name: Nice looking pants

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have some gray ones which actually fit better in same size. Beware pet owners if buying black. Otherwise great hiking/casual capri.
review.name: Love these but black attracts pet fur

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are just the right length, I like the adjustable ties at the knees so they don’t slide down on my legs.  They are a nice light weight material which makes them feel cool on me.  They wash up nicely too.  These are pretty much my favorite kind of capris to wear.
review.name: Comfy pants

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: The top half of these pants is not true to size.  They were very tight and low on the hips.  It was as if a size 6 hip was put on a size 10 pant.  The length was good hitting just below the knee...  I returned them.
review.name: Awkward sizing
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry the sizing didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance, or exact measurements.

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these shorts! They are so comfy, durable, and stylish to boot!
review.name: Amazing shorts!

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought three pairs in size 6 on sale. I am 5'6", 124, and normally wear a S or 6 in Columbia pants. These were nice quality but way too short in the rise for me (and I am short-waisted). Because they fit well in the waist and hips, I decided not to try a larger size. I am disappointed but will try other styles.
review.name: Very nice but ran small

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These knee pants are great, I use them for walking and hiking and have taken them on travel trips.  They pack well and are easy to move and sit in so a perfect travel companion.  I also wear them as a casual knee pant.
review.name: These are Great pants for walking and hiking.

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, light weight--great for warm weather and better than shorts!
review.name: Better than shorts

review.itemreviewed: Saturday Trail II Knee Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very cooling and comfortable to wear in the summer.
review.name: Cooling

review.reviewBody: These draws are great. We love the keepers and the thick webbing, it makes it really easy to clip. All my crag friends say "whoa those are really nice" when I loan out a draw or two. Buy them you won't regret it. Also can't beat the price on here!

review.reviewBody: Easy to clip and grip. Feels a bit heavy, but it provides me with a lot of security when taking regular whips on projects. The fun pink color I got was pretty snazzy too.
review.name: Sturdy and good for projects

review.reviewBody: Longer quickdraws were a perfect addition to my climbing kit.  Works great at the anchors, back up PAS etc.  Does exactly what you want from a quickdraw.
review.name: Great quickdraws

review.reviewBody: Quickdraws that do what they are supposed to do and live up to name "Workhorse".  These are going to last me a long time, and you can't beat the EV price for 17cm draws.  These are great all around or projecting draws, and I will probably be buying them again in a few years.
review.name: Fantastic longer draws

review.reviewBody: Great draw for making long or difficult clips.  Very stiff and ergonomical dog bone, smooth gate action. A staple on my sport rack whether I'm making RP burns or onsight attempts.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I would recommend getting the 17cm quickdraw for outdoor sport climbing due to its length which minimizes rope drag, thick dogbone for a sure grip and keylock carabiner feature so you don't snag on any gear. The quickdraw is on the heavier side but trust it will do it's job and keep me safe in the crag.
review.name: Great overall outdoor quickdraw

review.reviewBody:
This was a nice looking shoe; but it didn't fit.  I was walking out of the heel.  I tried different lacing positions, but could not stop my heel from slipping out of the shoe when walking.



this was a nice
review.name: waterproof shoe

review.reviewBody: This shoe is both a hit and a miss all in one. The cushion is amazing, and that's where the good ends. I like to buy Merrell's because the insoles are removable and I can put my custom insoles in. Unfortunately, whoever designed the Agility Peak 5 for women has no idea what shape a foot is. When you remove Merrell's insole you can see that the area where the arch is is extremely narrow. While the area for the feet is extremely wide.  Due to the arch area being so narrow, my custom insoles do not lie flat when placed into the shoe. This results in the arch "bump" of my insoles jutting into the arch of my foot causing me pain. I have bought other insoles but no luck.  No insole is that narrow in the arch area of a foot.  Not even for women. Unfortunately, I didn't realize all this before first wearing the shoes outside (so now I'm stuck with them and can't return them, which is really upsetting).  I have tried wearing them with the original insole, but I need way more arch support than those insoles offer.  Also, because of the wide area for the toes it feels like my feet are swimming inside these shoes. Not what you want for a hike. So, I'm extremely regretful that I didn't know beforehand that not only do I need to check if an insole is removable, but I must also check the dimensions at the very bottom of the shoe to make sure regular insoles work. To date I have worn these only once. I have no idea what I'm going to do with these shoes. I'm still waiting for several sets of insoles to come in in the hopes that I can jerry rig a solution to the poor dimensions of these shoes. But, every time I look at them I am just filled with regret. I got these on a 50% off discount, but it's still a lot of money to throw out and that's all I want to do with these shoes.
review.name: Only regrets

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous shoes  I have a coat  to match Thank u Very safe for walking  not slippery love the colour
review.name: Beautiful Runners
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are comfortable out of the box.  You do not have to break them in.  I have ample space in the toe bed.  I would definitely recommend these shoes.
review.name: Great Buy!
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Good support. Haven’t tested out the waterproof feature. Great for uneven surfaces. Happy with my purchase
review.name: Good support, great for uneven surfaces

review.reviewBody: Merrell's have been my go-to hiking shoes for over 15 years. They're comfortable right out of the box and don't need breaking in. The Agility Peak 5 is lightweight and packs well for traveling. I recently hiked the Salkantay Trail in Peru and was the only one in my group who didn't lose a toenail! My shoes were super comfortable even after 12+ miles of hiking a day. Excellent grip on the steep rocky trails.
review.name: My Go-To Hiking Shoes
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Ann!

review.reviewBody: I really tried to convince myself these were a good buy but they're just not working for me. Someone said it already, that the heel feels really low- I thought they'd meant the cushion but it's the actual shoe part that's low, like it's somehow well below the ankle, only an inch and a half up the Achilles from the base. It feels like I'm walking on TOP of a shoe, and not like my foot is safely IN a shoe. It doesn't feel secure. And the cushion is just too dang thick, I can't even tell what I'm stepping on, I've almost rolled an ankle several times. Grip is good on dry conditions but was slippery on slick rocks, not as good as I hoped/paid for. Knew they were a miss at the end of our third outing, feet were on the verge of blisters and I couldn't wait to put on different shoes that were closer to the ground and actually felt secure. Freakin moon shoes basically, bummed.
review.name: Unstable moon shoes

name: Agility Peak 5 GTX Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Arguably the overall best shoes I've worn! That's saying a lot after a lifetime and multiple pairs of good and horrible dogs. When I took them out of the box, I thought "too small"... boy was I wrong. The synthetic leather stretched to fit my slightly-flat feet like a glove of love. This is a shoe that will see a lot of use on all my different bikes. Take my $!
review.name: Superior!

review.reviewBody:
Was hesitant to spend the money but well worth it. I will not look for anything else as I kept trying out shoes at local shops and nothing seemed to impress me until I received these. I'd consider myself a Groadie as I do an equal amount gravel and road riding on my one bike, these shoes work perfect in both scenarios which typically is riding on road to get to dirt. 

Comfortable on long mixed rides, super stiff and responsive, and clean incredibly easy. Also I have never had issues with the laces coming loose as this was one of my concerns.
review.name: Best Cycling Shoes I've Owned

review.reviewBody:
Completely stiff, very light, ok to walk in, durable and very very comfortable.

With previous shoes (sidi dominator, specialized) I was having pretty severe foot pain from my toes smashing front of shoe when mountain biking. Pain so severe that I had to count to help ignore the pain during races. Big race was coming up and I needed to do something. Tried 5-6 different pairs in seattle area, everything that I could get my feet into and nothing was very good.

Ordered 6 pairs of shoes from all over the internet in multiple sizes, every brand i could find in my size. These were the only shoes that really controlled my foot. The laces are key - the included arch support was a nice touch.

I normally wear a 12.5 but have an enormous arch and can't get my feet into many boots. These shoes are simply awesome. I happily paid full msrp for the first pair. Bought a second pair when bright red was on sale at 1/2 price.

Absolutely no regrets these have been terrific. Laces are good for about 2.5 years but shoes are going strong.

I am 100% singlespeed mtb, rain or shine and I don't even think about my feet any more.
review.name: Tough to Fit Feet - My Dream Shoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit the bill for a lightweight, stiff gravel/road shoe. They have a kind of cool, retro look and don't look or feel too clunky when used on the road. No issues with the laces although I did shorten them so they don't flop as much (there is an elastic keeper to hold the loose ends). The uppers do seem to break in with time. I wouldn't rate these as the coolest shoe but I can't say that my feet ever get uncomfortably warm - just that the breathability seems below average. I have narrow, low volume feet and these shoes fit beautifully with no heel slippage when walking. There is choice of three arch supports for the insoles and the shoes come with an extra set of laces. I've only used these shoes in clean, dry conditions so I can't attest to their durability in rough, wet or muddy riding but I expect that they would cleanup and dry pretty quick. I've only ever had to wipe them with a damp cloth.
review.name: Great Gravel Shoes

name: Empire VR90 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these in last years model which are pretty much the same aside the gaiters on this year's version are a little nicer. Great pants but definitely be aware of the fit. It's great they have come out with more size options because the Ortovox size chart is often way off.  I got a size large and am 6'1 and 172lbs. I also highly recommend you buy the suspenders.  I haven't seen them sold here but you can find them on Ortovox's website. No matter what outdoor activity you're planning on using these for, I highly recommend investing in the suspenders.  They are kind of pricey like all Ortovox gear (retail roughly 40 dollars) but are worth it especially if you plan on skiing or free riding etc.   these are the lightest hardshell pants I could find for my winter long distance hiking.  My only wish was they had more pockets but no matter my 3l Ortovox jacket has plenty.  I would highly recommend these to anyone who's looking for a lightweight, weather proof hardshell pant.  I do advise trying to wait and look for sales because although Ortovox gear imho is the best it can be very expensive.
review.name: Great lightweight 3L pants

review.reviewBody: For my Japan trip, I bought this Thule SUBTERRA 2 CARRY ON SPINNER VETIVER GRAY and Thule SUBTERRA 2 CONVERTIBLE CARRY ON VETIVER GRY from the Vancouver store. I went on 3-week trip to Japan. The luggage design is great and well-thought-out inside, but Thule decided to put in the worst luggage wheel in this carry-on, the wheel is super noisy even on smooth surfaces I have a recording of the top piece " Thule SUBTERRA 2 CONVERTIBLE CARRY ON VETIVER GRAY" when I put on top of the carry on will tip the whole carry on over due to poor weight distribution. It does not happen when I put it on another brand carry-on.  Thule should change the wheel to hinomoto miraclent or silent run wheel then this carry can be a 5 star rating for now it stays as 1 star.
review.name: Good case with the worst wheel

review.reviewBody: Excellent product, perfect for a few days trip. Excellent quality
review.name: The carry-on you need

review.reviewBody:
I am very with this product because it is very smart and lightweight.
I purchesed other products of Thule but amazin this nem generation
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Thule Subterra 2 55cm carry-on spinner not only excels in style and organization but also offers impressive storage capacity. Despite its compact size, this carry-on maximizes every inch of space, allowing you to pack efficiently for short trips or weekend getaways.

Thanks to its thoughtful design, the Subterra 2 provides ample room for your essentials without feeling bulky or cumbersome. Its main compartment is spacious enough to accommodate clothing, shoes, and toiletries, while the internal compression panel helps to keep everything neatly in place.

Additionally, the suitcase features multiple zippered pockets and compartments, perfect for stashing smaller items like electronics, documents, and accessories. This ensures that your belongings stay organized and easily accessible throughout your journey.

Whether you're a minimalist packer or someone who likes to be prepared for any situation, the Subterra 2 offers versatile storage options to suit your needs. With this carry-on spinner by your side, you'll never have to sacrifice convenience for style again.
review.name: The Ultimate Carry-On Spinner for Style, Organization, and Storage"

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great little suitcase. It seems very durable and made with great material. The handle slides out very easily, and it rolls smoothly. The size is excellent, and it has many little compartments to stay organized. It's a great carry-on or even for an overnight or long weekend getaway.
review.name: Vacation must have!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received these products for free from Influenster and Thule in exchange for my honest review."

The best luggage out there!  We had the opportunity to review this luggage and even better, it was perfect timing for our vacation!  The sleek black soft yet hard side spinner carry on is phenomenal!  It’s hard side but still soft, rolls super smooth, the zippers are built great.  We didn’t have a single issues with anything breaking.  Has great separation and many pockets!  I would definitely purchase this luggage in all varieties and recommend to my clients as well!
review.name: The Smoothest!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Subterra 2 carry on luggage is light, great quality, opens like softsided luggage but has an almost hard shell.  It doesn’t look bulky but has plenty of room. The wheels are very smooth and strong.
review.name: Wonderful carry-on luggage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comparing this to a previous carry on that I owned it is night and day, the zippers are top notch and I feel like you don’t need to worry about them getting stuck.  The wheels roll very smoothly compared to other brands.  Lots of space inside and ways to get personal care items separate from clothes.  The hard shell is nice to keep things inside protected as well.  Overall this is a great carry on bag.
review.name: Everything you need in a lightweight bag

name: Subterra Carry On Spinner Bag

review.reviewBody: This is the first piece from Velocio that I purchased. After seeing a lot of their work in person, I have always liked the brand and their pieces look nice. These are not their top of the line shorts and I expected the quality to be high but lake some of extra details. And this is the case. These are very functional and have a very comfortable Velocio pad. The reason I am giving these 4 out of 5 stars is that the wide elastic around the thighs is very snug. My thighs are fairly skinny yet these give me the sausage look as they squeeze that area. Because the leg ends are tight, pulling them on takes a little more care. I don't notice the snugness when riding. I followed the Velocio sizing guide and the overall fit (outside of the leg en being snug) is good.
review.name: Very good but not great

review.reviewBody: Size of this waist pack is ideal for short hikes and carrying the necessities around an urban environment for cycling and shopping. Superior materials and contains 2 pockets for keys, phone and cards. Like all Gregory products ( of which I have many ) it is constructed for durability and has a stylish appearance.
review.name: Just right for carrying what you need.

review.reviewBody: This waist pack is perfect for me to use walking my doggie, can hold a small water bottle, fetch ball in main compartment and separate my keys, other small items in the front zipper pocket, and my cell phone in the padded back pocket. It’s a bigger pack yet light for when I need to carry something on my walk.  I especially like the loop which I could put a small biner to attach a water bowl and hat. I was picky but this has everything I am looking for.  High quality. I love the teal/orange/purple color. The only improvement is that the waist belt is long for me and I need a way to bundle them so I don’t have long dangling nylon. I used a think rubber band on each side to hold them together.
review.name: Well thought out waist pack to walk my dog

review.reviewBody: Quality build, spacious compartments. Very impressed. I wear it as a sling/cross chest bag.
review.name: Quality Build

review.reviewBody: This pack has the perfect amount of storage that I was looking for. The material is lightweight, attractive and seems to be durable. My only complaint is the straps do not stay tight, so as I'm walking they loosen and the pack slides down. I think if the buckles had "ridged" edges that may keep the strap in place.
review.name: Nano Waist Pack

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size. I can fit a 24 oz water bottle, wallet, keys, and phone just fine. Could probably also fit a snack. I previously purchased the nano regular size but it was too big for me. This nano mini is the best.
review.name: Finally found the perfect fanny pack

review.reviewBody: I haven’t used my pack yet but I love the quality , color, size and all the compartments. It’s going to be perfect for all of my outdoor activities. I also just purchased the Gregory 36L backpack. Love love love the quality
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: Great size, good structure. It REALLY needs some elastic bands to hold the straps when you adjust the waistband to be smaller. I am going to have to sew some on myself.
review.name: Great pack, needs an update

review.reviewBody: I wanted a sporty looking bag to carry to the gym and this is perfect! Fits my phone, wallet, headphones, and some other small items. And I can clip my gym cards to the small loop on the side for easy scanning. Wish it had elastic bands to keep the straps from hanging loose, but some hair ties did the trick.
review.name: Sporty Day Bag

review.reviewBody: well made. maybe another loop to secure the end of the strap
review.name: design

review.reviewBody:
I really like the Waist Pack. It holds a ton and rides comfortably below my pack strap. The only thing I would change is to make it waterproof. If it was, I doubt Gregory could make enough to keep up with the demand.
I would recommend.
North Carolina / Age-65 / Male
4 of 5 stars / High value - I will use it on the trail.
No incentive for this review
review.name: Like it a Lot - Wish it was waterproof.

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of Wildcats that I bought specifically to complete the John Muir Trail in CA.  I bought GTX only because they were on sale.  I wore previous pairs on Colorado Trail and Wonderland Trail, in addition to many miles of day hiking.  As typical, I sized up a full size from what I would wear for street walking, to allow toes to expand and wiggle.  I personally prefer the tougher sole and reinforced arch and heel caps to the the softer soled Altra Lone Peaks and various Hokas (I wear both brands for road running).   The Wildcats help me withstand the rocky trail, but give my feet relief compared to boots.  GTX does not breath or dry as quickly, obviously, so could take or leave it, however when hiking through shallow water and lots of snow on trail my feet tended to stay drier.  If completely submerged it will take longer to dry.  One needs to air out feet frequently on trail anyway, weather its super hot, or colder and wet, regardless of footwear.  I love these shoes.  No shoe lasts forever, though, and I have noticed in previous pairs that the rubber nubs on the sole that do very well for traction (the orange ovals) also tend to wear down rather quickly while there is otherwise a lot of wear left on the shoe.
review.name: Great Backpacking Trail Runner

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Overall a good shoe. But with one MAJOR flaw, especially considering this is the Gore-Tex version: The soles are extremely slippery when wet!
I’m quite sure footed and very comfortable crossing logs or scrambling up rocks. In the last decade I can’t say I have had any shoes that made me uncomfortable to cross logs or step onto wet rocks. This shoe did just that. Went out for a maiden backpacking trip, it rained and all of a sudden what felt like good grippy shoes were just slipping all over. Fine on dry rocks, unreliable when wet. 
At first I thought “it must just be this rock”, but it kept happening. I slipped and feel on a small patch of wet grass, happens, but these were just next level slippery. Then I had to cross a small foot bridge, nice flat wood plank and was grateful to have trekking poles as it was a bit wet and I felt I could lose my feet from under me at any point as they were literally sliding on the wooden bridge. So disappointed. Was hoping to take it on a longe thru hike but can’t consider that anymore after this experience. Such a shame they didn’t test this properly for a waterproof shoe :/
review.name: Caution: Slippery when wet!

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was going to purchase The Ultra Raptor II GTX, but it was never available in my size. I was looking at these as a backup and finally my size became available in these Wildcats. I was looking for a good Gortex trail runner to keep my feet dry. These felt great right out of the box. Ten minutes into my run they felt like butter on my feet. Stable, well cushioned, good traction, responsive and kept my feet nice and dry. They pretty much check all the boxes. I only do shorter runs, 3-6 miles, but I do go out almost everyday and I've only had them for a couple weeks, so we'll see how durable they are. Some people have complained about the traction, but I've had them on wet roots and rocks without any issues. The only negative I can think of is availability, but that has nothing to do with the shoes. Everything has supply chain issues right now, so I can't really fault La Sportiva for that. Bottom line is, these are great shoes.
review.name: Pleasantly Surprised

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Over the past years I have bought at least ten pairs of this shoe.  When new they are great performers. The soles last a long time, they have great support, are actually waterproof, and are stiff enough to give great edging in off trail side-hill scrambling. They are not perfect however, and they consistently have had 3 problems.
 1. For waterproof shoes they do not grip well at all on wet rocks or wood. 
 2. Invariably, well before the shoes show any wear anywhere else, the linings of the heels get worn through.
 3. Several pairs have had lace loops break through and are irreparable, which is odd because the simple woven nylon lace loops on my several pairs of non GTX version never wear out here.
But in the end I like these shoes well enough to keep buying them. Though I do wish these problem areas would be fixed.
review.name: Really Like these Shoes, But...

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This show is probably mis-cast as a trail-runner, but is absolutely fantastic as a light hiker.

Insole has good structure to it to keep you steady on uneven ground, but also has great cushion/bounce.

The outsole is grippy and does well on gravely downhills. I have read it?s slippery on wet smooth surfaces like concrete, but I live in a dry climate and only use it on trails.

The waterproofing is excellent and keeps me totally dry on stream crossings (though it?s got a low ankle so watch your depth).

PS size up
review.name: My favorite light hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had two pairs of these home and while they are super comfortable they have a major issue. Both pairs have had a loud clicking noise as you walk, almost like something is not glued correctly in the soles. The first pair was only the right shoe, the second pair were both shoes. So loud that even people walking with you can hear it.
review.name: Problem with shoe

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First few times wearing were pretty uncomfortable but I could tell the shoes just needed broken in. Once they were broken in they became extremely comfortable and I now love these shoes. I trail run in wetter conditions and also use these shoes for hiking when I will be going through a wet zone and want something light and waterproof. The waterproofing works well so far. Worn shoes about ten times and for about 30 miles or so total. Normally wear EU size 42.5 and I chose that and they fit snug with a little room in the toe box for spreading out toes for stress relief during wear.
review.name: Awesome Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a had a few pairs of the GTX and non GTX Wildcats.  They are super comfortable out of the box, the GTX naturally takes a little more time to soften up.  They are such a comfortable shoe but the outsoles wear down so quickly (super soft).  I love everything about these shoes except that the outsoles are done when the rest of the shoe barely has miles on them.
review.name: Outsole does not last.

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I actually have both the GTX and non-GTX version of this show.  I bought the non-GTX version first for a hike through Scotland that was a bit unwise.  But the shoe was comfortable.  So I bought the GTX version for a recent section hike of the PCT in Washington.  I knew that the soles were slick, but they turned out to be dangerously so.  

I'm fairly use to the slipperiness of rocks in streams.  Still, I was pretty shocked at how slick these shoes were while trying to balance on a rock during a recent stream crossing.  I made it across to a large, flat rock, turned slightly and it was like I was standing on ice.  My feet went out from under me, landed in freezing cold water, soaking my lower body, lost a trekking pole and very easily could have broken a wrist or something.

If you ONLY, ONLY, ONLY plan on hiking or running in dry environments, I guess this shoe would be good for you.  I've seriously almost slipped in city when it was raining.  The soles are THAT BAD.  Which is too bad.  I really want to like this show.
review.name: comfy show that's like walking on ice

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My third pair of wildcat gtxw- wish it came in brighter colors but awesome shoe
review.name: Third pair- great shoes

name: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the GSI Outdoors Pinnacle Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This stove broke after two weeks into a backpacking trip. The hose unfortunately started leaking and little flames would travel up and down the hose while the stove was on. When I contacted GSI customer service they refused to replace the part or the stove altogether. Such a bummer that this company doesn't stand behind their product. I've had the same MSR Pocket Rocket since 2007 that stove has held its own for years in all conditions, I should have just rolled with the old MSR stove.
review.name: Just buy an MSR instead!

review.reviewBody: Watch the youtube  video on this where they turn the tank on its side in the coldest of winters.  This stove really does everything it claims and so much more.  We did the 4 season which there is no picture for.  The tank attaches by a metal tube, included in the package.  This allows you to do a liquid feed on super cold days and tank up for everything else.  It is not efficient, more of a real fast boiling flame thrower that uses a quarter of a 400g can of fuel every time you boil something.  You can regulate it down to a simmer with a little work and it is very solid.  Even fairly large pots sit on it nicely, two and three liter is what we tried and it was nice!  We bought a second one which at 80 bucks, says it all.  It is worth the luxury 5 ounce weight and the flame is nice and smooth.  What a great product for anyone who wants a stove that will work perfectly all the time.  PS:  No wind guard was purchased.  In high wind it stayed lit and heated 2 liters of water to a boil at 7,000 feet in about 15 minutes with a half a can of fuel.  Gets the job done every time!
review.name: great stove but uses a ton of fuel

name: Pinnacle Stove

review.reviewBody: The suit itself is nice BUT It's awfully hard, almost impossible (not exaggerating!), to put boots or gloves on, there's no zipper or Velcro to get the suit over anything. It's long enough but fairly tight around the hips, so our 11month old walker, hates trying to walk in it and is not capable of getting up by himself again, which he usually does and did with other suits before (rain and fall suit)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The new snow suit and boots kept my grandson warm and dry!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son is 15 months but wears 9-12 months clothes. He is wearing 18-24 months. He will be able to utilize this suit for at least 2 years. We live in Minnesota and our winters are brutal with temps expecting to be -9 in the upcoming weeks. This suit keeps him warm. It's not so bulky on him even though the arms and legs are long. It is thin enough but extremely warm because he is sweating when we get home.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Bjorn Daehlie Comfy Sweater - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Overall I really like this sweater. The fabric isn't nearly as soft as pure merino, but it's still fairly comfy, and the fit and colors are cute. However, the zipper garage is either defective on the one I got or poorly designed. In order to pull the zipper up the last inch, I have to manually pull apart the layers of the garage, force the zipper into it, then rearrange the layers around it. I've never had this issue with a zipper garage before, including on other wool sweaters, and it's way too high maintenance, even at the sale price.
review.name: nice sweater, defective zipper garage

review.reviewBody: Had never even heard of this brand until a recent trip to Alaska. The store up there didn’t have my size so I found it on backcountry.com. Quick shipping as always. Thrilled with my purchase. I get many compliments on it every time I wear it.
review.name: My new favorite pullover

review.reviewBody: I've worn this skiing a couple of times and it keeps me warm. I bought a medium and it's a little big for me (5'2", 125#) but fits well with a base layer under my ski jacket. The neck is a little high for me. I would probably order a small if I had to do over. I like it.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: Sharp looking, very comfortable and warm! Fits to size, I bought a medium and plenty of room, could have sized down maybe but it's good to be able to layer underneath. The brand named after the guy is a cross country Olympics skier, so the front is warmer, which is what I was looking for. I hate it when my chest gets cold. It's cold here so doesn't make my chest sweat as other reviewer mentioned. Doesn'tseem noisy to me either which was in another  review. I just bought another one.
review.name: Love it!

name: Comfy Sweater - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago, needed a waterproof running vest for solo long distance self supported run in Scotland. The size of the waterproof main compartment is good, and it is good to have the elastic on outside but this bag is very limited in function, they have used to much waterproof fabric for the other pockets making things slide around too easily. Full 500ml soft bottles are difficult to get in the pockets (especially if re-filling water on the go) and are positioned a little too low. I like having a waterproof zip pocket on the front but think this vest would be much better if it the same design as the other adv skin vests with much more stretchy fabric and simply have a waterproof main compartment. I have tested this on a number of longer fell runs (around 30km). It is a good size for what I need but I am disappointed that the design doesn’t seem to work as well as the other vests (difficult to reach the side pockets whilst wearing). I didn’t mind not getting soft bottles as I already have plenty of them.
review.name: Needed waterproof running vest
comment: We thank you for providing this feedback. We will use this feedback to improve our products. We apologise that the vest was not as expected. We have sent you an email also. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: I already had the advanced skin that I’ve used on a couple of long runs but for this 25 miles of coastal path we had a long list of essential kit which wouldn’t fit in my other bag. This was perfect. The weather wasn’t though and despite some quite heavy rain everything stayed dry inside. Really pleased. Worth the money
review.name: Man vs Coast

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: Bought this for doing UTMBs UTS had it on my back for 12 hours still comfortable kit still dry at the end although little disappointed no pole quiver attachments and wasn’t obvious that didn’t come with bottles like my last two cheaper vests did so feel quite over priced
review.name: Comfortable
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products!

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: This is the first running vest I have used, and it works great. Very comfortable and has ample storage. I have used it about 5 times in the few weeks I've had it, I got it for a July trip to speed trek the TMB.
review.name: ADV Cross Season Very Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: The size has been perfect in the colder weathers where I have to keep some extra layers in the pack. Very comfy and cool looks (which is a bonus!)
review.name: My new go-to!

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest
review.reviewBody: The beauty of this Vest is that it feels very natural on the body. I returned mine because i got a size large when i needed a medium, this is very important to get right! Just a little slop in the vest with the added load capacity + filled soft flasks can provide a lot of unwanted movement. This is a great high performance addition to your gear; ex. race day pack or weekend run pack. I would not recommend for a daily; ex running to work or grocery shopping run. For this i use something more user friendly with Buckles around chest and velcro on top storage area instead of chest pull cords. (pull cords do feel better)
review.name: High Capacity Running Vest

name: Adv Skin Cross Season Race Running Vest

review.reviewBody:
I wore out my BD Momentum. I was synching it down with nothing to spare at XL. I purchased the Safe Tech Trad Harness in a large, as per the measurement guide, and it's way too big. I'm synching it down with nothing to spare and it's not quite tight enough. I wanted it to work so bad I didn't exchange it. I knew the gear loops would be too far back in a medium. I ordered the Misty Mountain Turbo in a Large and it fits perfectly. It has a three inch gap between the two ends. 0-3 inches is the stated "perfect fit". I think something is wrong with the Metolius, it's fits exactly like a XL with the gear loops to far back.
My pants size is 33 and my waist measures 35.5
review.name: Sizing is off

name: Turbo Harness

description: Buy the Thule Hullavator Pro Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hullavator Pro Kayak Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Hullavator Pro Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: There are some changes to the design since my first purchase some 20 years ago, hoping for the better.  No longer any locking pin to positively lock the kayak in place.  Hope this was fully proven.  Also, considering the price paid, I expected locks to come with the rack.  My old racks are still useable but the shocks need replacement and the plastic head on the adjustment screws broke long ago.  Unit is pricey but it does last, easy to use.
review.name: Third Hullivator Purchase

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'2" with a 60 lb kayak and a tall vehicle. I hesitated in getting the hullavator for a couple.years because it's pricy and for me it would require an upgrade if my cross bars. Well I finally bit the bullet and made the purchase, 

I went with the square bars and even though the 139 was recommended on the site, based on my vehicle, I ordered the 150 because the hullavator needs 4 to 8 inches of overhang past the foot where it attaches to your vehicle side rails.
The whole set up was easy to install myself. It didn't take long at all and I went slow to be sure to do it all to specifications.

I could not be happier with the purchase as it means I can easily dash out for a paddle when the mood and the weather strikes without waiting on someone else to help me load and unload. 
If transport is your biggest barrier to getting on the water then just get the hullavator.

I do have one complaint and it's more of an annoyance than anything. I had to search extensively to figure out if the racks and the hullavator came with a key to secure things. It appeared that the racks did but the hullavator did not  so I went ahead and just ordered a 2 key set of the Thule one key (which was also hard to find on this site)
Well I wish I would have gotten the 6 key set as the racks only came with a plastic toggle.
Please Thule update your product descriptions to include whether or not your product includes a key lock (especially when your install directions imply that they do but they don't). It was disappointing to spend this much money and now still have to order extra bits and pieces. It would be a simple fix on your end.
review.name: The difference between getting out or not

review.reviewBody: The haulavator is so easy to use it makes loading kayaks so quick
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: The Hullavator Pro is such a ease to use. No more heavy lifting of kayaks up over my shoulder and throwing them onto the roof of my SUV. Intelligently designed and easy to use. Thanks Thule.
review.name: Well Designed...

review.reviewBody: We bought this last month and finally just had it installed and it works perfectly and is so easy to use that we are thinking of getting a second one…Even though it is quite useful when going out on my own, the ease to use it makes it quite appealing for our second kayak!
review.name: Great, fantastic, awesome kayak rack!

review.reviewBody: My old town pdl 106 is too wide for the rack. Need to make a hullavator that accommodates wider yaks
review.name: Old town pdl 106 is too wide for the rack

review.reviewBody: I put the Hullavator Pro on my Four Wheel Camper Ford f350 4WD vehicle.  I am delighted with it.  There is now way that I could manage the kayak myself without it given that I am only 5'5" and 125 pounds with spaghetti arms.  I use a jumbo ladder with three steps and its perfect.  Thanks for making such a quality product.
review.name: Perfect for short single women with spaghetti arms

review.reviewBody: After a fairly easy installation, I was amazed at how well this product works. I’ve never had the strength to lift my kayak onto J hooks on the top of my car by myself. With the Hullavator it’s so easy! Very fast for loading and unloading the boat and I feel confident it’s secure while I’m driving.
review.name: Great product, worth the money

review.reviewBody:
Product is Great 
Still trying to get my full order
review.name: Doubled my order

review.reviewBody: Pratique pour aider à monter le kayak sur le toit. Facile à utiliser.
review.name: Super!

name: Hullavator Pro Kayak Carrier

review.reviewBody: I'm so disappointed as I love the material, construction and color (brown), however the fit runs extremely small!  I'm 5'4" 115lb and wear small in Fox, Club Ride and Dakine so after looking over the fit chart I felt confident in getting size small.  After waiting a week for the package to arrive I opened it up and seriously laughed at how small the shorts are.  They can fit someone in elementary school.  So bummed that now I have to return them, UGH.
review.name: BEWARE THE FIT RUNS EXTREMELY SMALL!

review.reviewBody: My all time favorite shorts were my POC Women's Trail Shorts.  I am a cyclist... I therefore have quads.  They fit me perfectly in a way that shorts NEVER fit me.  I eagerly bought these: same wonderful tough but stretchy fabric... same comfortable waist... but hugged my legs like they were lycra.  Devastated.  I am giving 3 stars because the material is awesome.  I have crashed in them (my old POC's) and it averted road rash, but they are also so stretchy and never too hot for me.  Great quality but so sad they changed the fit.
review.name: They changed the fit.  BOO!!!

review.reviewBody: Just tried these on, but first impression is good! Based on the reviews I bought L. My first instinct was to trade in for a medium because they were a tiny bit baggy, but I'll hold onto them and see after a ride.  They have a velcro thing on the back so you can tighten the waist if you need to. I had to tighten it a little bit. These will look super good with knee pads. They're nice and king with two zip pockets in the front.
review.name: Finally, long shorts

review.reviewBody: This was my second pair of these shorts. The length is great, the fabric is strong and stretchy, they're really comfortable. They are a slimmer fit. I'm 5'7" 130lbs and usually am a schmedium (between a small and medium) and the medium fits perfectly.
review.name: Favorite shorts
comment: Haha schmedium! This was super helpful - thank you!

review.reviewBody: I ordered probably 10 different mountain bike shorts to find the 'best' and these were it. I love the length (no knee pad gap!) and the fit. I ordered two pairs and I will be ordering more. The only thing I wish it had was a side pocket to hold my phone.
review.name: Best mountain bike shorts I've owned

review.reviewBody: The shorts are a bit more fitted, which I love for certain riding situations. Pockets are a little small but I love the look and feel and simply wear a fanny pack if I need to carry my giant phone. I don?t  Generally love the phone in my pocket anyway so it?s not a deal killer. Still love these shirts!!
review.name: Slim fitting, which I love!

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these shorts, I love POC, the material is amazing and they have zip pockets. However they were more fitted than I wanted them to be (if you have quads, these are NOT baggie), and the pockets were just a little small, they fit my phone but when pedaling the phone would bump into my pelvis. Unfortunately I'll have to return. 
For size reference, I'm a women's size 8-10 and the Large fit me well, aside from the thigh fit being more fitted then I'd like.
review.name: Slim fit and small pockets

name: Essential MTB Short - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: Shoe runs very narrow even in a wide size.  Not compatible with a tall foot. Returned immediately.  Shoes were very cute in colors!
review.name: Not a fit

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: My daughter is 5 and very active at school. She is outdoors daily and loves these shoes. We upgraded to these from the younger kids V4 Boa and they are better on the trail. Excellent shoe.
review.name: 5 Year Old Loves Them!

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: Our son has cerebral palsy & we are still on the hunt for the best running shoe for him. These shoes come in a wide size - great for fitting over his AFO - and the BOA system works really well, though ours son has a hard time easily reaching the dial on his affected side. The only real problem I have with them is that, because they are meant to be trail shoes, the soles are bulky and make the shoes heavy, so our guy can’t run as well. We tried the Dynasoft Reveal style, but the plastic cover on top gapped on his AFO and didn’t seem to fit right, not to mention the lack of breatheability was a concern. Hoping New Balance can solve these issues for the next season!
review.name: Great no-tie system, but heavy shoe

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: I have purchased this product twice for my Grand Nephew because he loves this shoe but both times they have not lasted any length of time. Most recent purchase was in February and by the end of March they already have a hole in them.
review.name: Terrible

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: My girl said they are so confortable and fits grate cause de BOA.
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: My kid loves them. They fit good and easy to tighten and loosen.
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Dynasoft Trail Magic BOA Shoe - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: Great fit and feel. My daughter loves them. Good quality and wears nicely.
review.name: Great shoe and cool look

review.itemreviewed: Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Horizon 12oz Camp Mug
review.reviewBody:
I bought one of these mugs for camping a year ago. My wife kept using it for her morning coffee because it fit in her car’s cup holder and basically she stole my mug. So for Mother’s Day this year I bought her her own in her favorite color. 

Just as good as any other insulated mug out there but sleeker.
review.name: I bought one of these

review.itemreviewed: Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Horizon 12oz Camp Mug
review.reviewBody: Love it! Keeps my coffee hot for several hours and easy to take with me in the car.
review.name: Love it! Keeps my coffee

review.itemreviewed: Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Horizon 12oz Camp Mug
review.reviewBody: Best mug ever! As someone who spends the entire year outside guiding tours I will definitely say I start everyday with a hot beverage, coffee or yerba mate. This mug keeps my drinks ripping hot for a very long time. As guide, I can have a few sips before tour and come back for a few more HOT sips before the next tour... love that. For me, I prefer the 12oz size, anything larger is more than I need, definitely holds enough for the perfect cup of coffee. Easy to drink from, comfortable in hand. Tough design that can handle a lot of action and outdoor life. It will leak a little bit if you hold it upside down above your head or throw it against the tree it will leak so if you are looking for a sippy cup for adults, this is not it. Great looking design, simple. Follows the high quality tradition of Camelbak products. I've been a customer since late '90s and that won't be changing anytime soon! Bring it to your local coffee shop and reduce waste.
review.name: Best Travel Mug I've ever owned

hasVariant.name: Serac Strap Crampon
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Serac Strap Crampon online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I needed something flexible for a snowboard boot, and these fit the bill. After multiple uses, I can say I love them and am so happy I bought them. They can be modified to fit a lot of sizes and the straps are long enough and then can be tucked away. I've been backcountry skiing and ice climbing in these!
review.name: Best Crampons for a Snowboard Boot

review.reviewBody: Used these for the Whitney Mountaineer’s route in late April on a mix of snow and rock. They held up well with no notable wear. Super sticky on the snow and a firm grip on mountaineering boots.
review.name: Great Crampons

review.reviewBody: These felt super secure on my feet, and I never felt like I was going to sleep or have problems with them.

These things are great. I bought to use with my Scarpa Zodiac Tech GTX. The front bail is easy to step into. The 12-points of contact make for quick travel. The heel-bail is easy to adjust and snaps onto your boot. I do have a little bit of rust forming on the bottoms of the crampons. Not sure if its the crampons or something I picked up on the mountain. I also found the thin strap hard to pull with gloves on. More surface area towards the end of the strap would be nice.
review.name: Quick and Easy

review.reviewBody: Perfect crampon for alpine climbing. Adjustable and easy to use. Get the crampon bag to protect your gear.

I bought these crampons for an upcoming expedition to Denali.  I recently took them on a winter training session to climb Mt. Washington. It was a perfect test as Mt. Washington was in usual winter form (white out/high winds/blowing graupel)   I used the serac crampons/strap version with my La Sportiva G2 boots.  The combination was terrific.  The combination was very stable and had plenty of traction on ice and snow.  These worked well even on higher angle sections that required french stepping and/or front pointing.
review.name: Super Stable - great crampons!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a versatile first crampon and found it with the BD search pro. I've climbed multiple colorado couliors and even done some mixed climbing in the serac. The stainless steel holds up well against rocks. Probably my favorite part of the serac are the multiple sizes of tow bails. They fit both my mountaineering and ski boots depending on my objective.

Got the strap version. Purchased this model due to the additional holes on the side of the fwd crampon. I figured if I need better control of the crampon, I could use the trailing hole on the side of the crampon to tie over the boot. This boot overhangs 3 inches per side. Of course I also purchased the large center bar. This is not for technical activity. I have a trip in January to Svalbard. Average temperature then is -40 C which is also -40 F.  Polar bears to people are 2 to 1. From what I researched, boot mfg and ice traction mfg don't talk to one another. Each one is in their own little world and the other one doesn't exist. I would have gone for the Contact model except it doesn't have the additional side holes.  The mandatory questions in this review are irrelevant to my quest
review.name: This might be overkill for my needs

review.reviewBody: I bought this product a week before hiking Mt Whitney, Lone Pine, CA. I was able to get through the chute early morning with confidence. Serac Crampons did not add much weight, kept my feet securely planted in the snow/ice, and allowed me to confidently hike up the chute. I had no problems using this product and would recommend it for anyone who is planning to hike in similar conditions.
review.name: I love this product

review.reviewBody: Climbed Mt. Rainier using Black Diamond Crampons. The performed well in the snow, ice, rock assents and back down through the melting slush. Not sure I would be alive today if I didn't have my Black Diamond Crampons on to help safely navigate the ice-fields. Thank you Black Diamond!
review.name: Awesome!

name: Serac Strap Crampon

review.reviewBody: I agree, the slots that run lengthwise of the shoe pick up at least one rock whenever I walk in gravel or rocky area. It is the first shoe where I’ve ever had to stop and do that. Also, the waterproof material feels more ‘plasticy’ in comparison to the regular. They have a different look. I’m not a big fan of what they’ve done with the waterproof lines.

review.reviewBody: This shoe picks up ALOT of rocks. Some you know and others you dont until you walk on your hard wood flooring. I dont like stopping to pick a rock out of the sole of my shoe every five minutes. I did not think these are as comfortable compared to other styles i have owned. They are more stiff. I wish I would’ve never bought them.

description: Buy the Black Diamond Jetforce UL 26L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jetforce UL 26L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Jetforce UL 26L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: First off, love the pack quality and the way it sits on the back and waist. It's obviously made from strong materials, but with a shovel and probe inside there's not a lot of storage space left. It's and ideal half day pack - maybe day - but recommended for those who are looking to carry light. The cartridge airbag system is also not the easiest to test prior to using. You essentially have to blow through 2 $50 cartridges, which can be difficult to find on the internet.
review.name: Great quality, not a ton of storage

review.reviewBody:
What good is an avy air bag if it sits in your tack room most of the time? BD has (at last count) three different deployment systems. This is likely the most expensive "per pull", but is the lightest and most comfortable of all the options that they offer. The dual cartridge system is easy to arm, i.e. connect the dual cartridges and secure the pull cable anchor in the shoulder strap harness. Plenty roomy for day trips in the heart of Colorado winter, this pack can also be stripped down for side country laps. The diagonal carry system is BD proven for all width of skis but may be awkward with split boards. There are three operable zippers on the exterior/top (not including the deployment zipper), one of which is used for the "goggle" pocket, another to stow the upper ski carry strap and the third for the main compartment. One minor niggle is that two of the zippers have identical black webbing pulls and the third has gray webbing; one would think that the designers would have specified a third color/shade so that each pull had it's only color scheme, but this is easy to rectify.
The main pocket has a zippered mesh pocket for small items, and a sleeved compartment for shovel, probe and saw. I use a K2 Recon "hoe" style shovel which fits perfectly and a BCA probe set. My BCA snow saw will also fit if its a study day. Everything is easy to grab and go.
In addition to simple operation, this pack is the best fitting pack out of six BD packs that I have owned. It's weird, like it was designed for me, incredible freedom of movement and close fit with no slop even when I endo (it happens). I am short-torso and orangutan limbs that drag in the skin track (sic).
Now, many might suggest that this deployment system is passe, a dead end in avy air bag evolution. Given the five to ten year operational life of an airbag pack and wide adoption of the twin cartridge system, I doubt that will be a problem. I bought this for the Home Crag and road tripping, not for air travel: for the latter, I will likely rent an airbag from a reliable outfitter. Again, that's my bias.
All in all, I would buy this again and would recommend it for its reliability and great fit.
review.name: Light, Roomy and a Reliable Inflation System

review.reviewBody: I have been impressed with this pack!  I've owned it for three months and it goes with me everyday.  I used to dread touring with an airbag but now don't think twice about taking this pack because of how light it is.  It's the perfect size for me to carry everything I need for a day in the backcountry touring.  This would be a perfect side country, cat, or heliski pack as well.
review.name: Great light weight airbag!

name: Jetforce UL 26L Backpack

hasVariant.name: Seeker 3L Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Seeker 3L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have had this bladder for three years now, have tried all suggested methods, lemon juice, vinegar, baking soda, denture tablets, etc. These work for maybe one use, then horrible taste follows. I love the durability of these bladders for bikepacking, but absolutely hate the smell. I wish Hydrapak would just admit issue with their product composition. But for an American corporations, that would mean putting consumers ahead of profits. It is more likely you could get pigs to fly. Maybe Politico could do a deep dive, and embarrass company, its the only way.
review.name: Cant get rid of awful plastic taste
comment:
Hi,

We are sorry you are experiencing a bad taste with your product. As a leading provider of performance hydration, any issue with our product is taken seriously. Our products are made from a food-grade Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) material. We have used this material since 2001 and it is used by many of our competitors. It is the industry standard because of its food-safe properties and its durability.

Since you've tested multiple suggested solutions and still are experiencing the bad taste. Please let us know by filing a warranty claim so we can help replace your Seeker.
You can file a warranty claim with the link provided below. 
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=913128
We look forward to helping you out and resolving this issue !

Thank you

review.reviewBody: Perfect addition for back up water during sections of long trail that have low water refill points.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I recently used the Seeker 3L on a backpacking trip.  It’s incredibly light and very compact. The built in handles were really handy when filtering.  Material seemed very strong.  The only thing keeping it from five stars is that the bag imparted and extremely strong plastic taste to the water.  It seemed to get stronger throughout the week instead of milder.  It made it difficult to enjoy my coffee and dehydrated meals.  I’m really hoping this subsides since this is such a great water carrier.
review.name: Great bag but strong plastic flavor
comment:
We are sorry you are experiencing a bad taste with your product. As a leading provider of performance hydration, any issue with our product is taken seriously. Our products are made from a food-grade Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) material. We have used this material since 2001 and it is used by many of our competitors. It is the industry standard because of its food-safe properties and its durability.

TPU is safe, reliable and non toxic. It’s 100% BPA and PVC free: every one of our products meets or exceeds the most rigorous national food safety standards in the world. Unfortunately, a small percentage of flask and reservoir users can experience an unpleasant taste, which varies from person to person. Please try to following to reduce the taste issue:

1) Fill the container up with water and add a few drops of lemon juice (about 1 teaspoon). Then place into your freezer and let it freeze overnight. Take the frozen container out of the freezer and let it thaw completely. Dump out lemon juice water and then rinse. The taste should be diminished.

2 ) Alternatively, you can fill the container up with milk (powdered milk works for this as well) and place it into the refrigerator for 24 hours. Then completely clean and dry the container. 

3) You can also use a Bottle Bright tablet and soak it with warm water for 30+ minutes. Then empty and rinse the reservoir or container, scrubbing it with a bristle brush. Rinse once more, completely and let dry fully prior to using.

4) For those that are extra sensitive to taste, we recommend using a Nuun tablet or a drop or two of lemon juice in their reservoir or container during activity. 

If these solutions do not work for you, please let us know

review.reviewBody: Best water bladder I have used for weight and durability combined
review.name: Tough for the weight

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Seeker 3L to use with my BeFree filter. The pairing worked really well. Each evening I would fill my Seeker as I arrived in camp. It cover my dinner and breakfast the next morning along with any drinking I needed in camp.
The handle and webbing worked good to carrying the full bottle back to camp. It also came in handy to gravity filter my water bottles. When the Seeker was empty it was easy to stow it away with the filter.
review.name: Trail Tested on a Appalachian Trail Thru Hike

review.reviewBody: The shape and size are of this bladder is spot on! Fits in my pack or can be easily secured to the outside of my pack. Its also nice that the filter will screw directly to it. And the best thing of all is how little space it takes up when it is empty...say good bye to Nalgene bottles!!!
review.name: Nice!!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for getting water in backcountry with minimal weight to your pack!!! Even better use with be free filter and cut weight and time making water on trail!
review.name: Essential for backpacking ❤️

review.reviewBody: Quality construction. Great customer service and warranty. Previous bag smelled and tasted of plastic, new bag sent under warranty does not smell or taste of plastic.
review.name: Great bag and customer service

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a backpacking trip that required me to start every day with 4L of water.  I used the 3L Seeker and a 1L water bottle.  I used the Seeker to refill the water bottle.  The Seeker is durable, as I had it on my back, in the dirt, sitting on pine cones, and with no issues.  Three challenges: 1. The bladder is flimsy and when you put the top on you have to be careful water doesn't pour out. 2. refilling the water bottles is tricky at first (again due to the flimsy nature). 3.  Heavy when full and challenging to find a spot on the pack to store.  That said, I would recommend this to anyone who needs a larger water capacity.  If you have more pockets perhaps a 1.5L or 2L will be easier to distribute the weight.
review.name: Convienent Water Storage with Some Challenges

review.reviewBody: I have had my pack for 6 months now I have used it on more than 10 trips and it has not failed or leaked on me... besides when I got di not screw on the cap
review.name: Just great

name: Seeker 3L Water Bottle
