review.itemreviewed: Mission XP Leather Approach Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was planning a trip to Joshua tree and a friend suggested getting these. I intended to do mostly hiking and some scrambling (no rope climbing) and planned to just wear hiking shoes. I decided to order and give these a try and WOW these are the shoes I didn't know I needed! They are sturdy and perform similar to your typical climbing shoe but are comfortable to walk in all day. These made me feel very confident while scrambling. Definitely a smaller fit and I would recommend sizing up a full size. I'm usually an 8.5/9 and ordered the 9.5, glad I did. They are snug but comfortable. My new go-to shoe for adventuring - would HIGHLY recommend if you are looking for something that performs better than hiking shoes.
review.name: My new adventure shoe!

name: Mission XP Leather Approach Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a nice piece, very soft and comfortable but unfortunately after wearing for only an hour I absolutely reeked. I don’t think it will be good for long hikes involving any sweat which is what I bought it for
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I have many of these Crater Lake Long Sleeve Hoody's ... I love how light weight the fabric is ... it is wonderful for layering.  I DO wish they would come in some basic plain colors ... like dark grey, dark brown, black.  I will continue to purchase these ... they are my favorite tops by far.
review.name: Favorite Top

review.reviewBody:
I've had this sun hoody for 1 year now, and these are my thoughts:

Pros: The material is sooo soft and comfortable. It offers good stretch, hasn't snagged or torn, and is generally just nice to wear.
Cons: The fit is just off. For me, the hoody is about 6" too long, and the drawstring just ends up between my legs when I'm walking (and is one extra hurdle to overcome when you have to water a tree, if you know what I mean). The hood is large enough to wear over a helmet, but is too large and constantly falls down if I'm not wearing a helmet. The hood also offers zero front neck coverage.

Move the drawstring from the bottom to the hood, shorten the garment a bit, and add a little front neck coverage and this would be an awesome hoody. However, as it is now I tend to reach for the other sun hoodies in my closet.
review.name: Almost Good

review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite light weight pull overs. It’s also great for travel.
review.name: Soft materials

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and durable. High quality. My wife is very pale and we live at altitude so she basically lives in these shirts. She won't wear any others.
review.name: Awesome shirts

review.reviewBody: Fabric is a lightweight and feels good on you.  Breathes easily.  Little zipper pouch on side is a nice bonus, enough for a key or some &. I wouldn’t put anything real happy as the fabric is very light.
review.name: I like the Fabric and fit of this shirt.

review.reviewBody: Cute and a great color. However all the stitching is on the outside of the shirt. Went for a hike and by the end all the seams were fluffy due to trees and plants. We weren’t fully bushwhacking, so I was shocked that the seams were shredded. There were no seams pulling apart, but I didn’t want to keep it to find out
review.name: Cute, but bad design!

review.reviewBody: Love these shirts.  I have multiple. Wash well I wear around town or hiking. Love the pocket. I use the hood to block sun and bugs. I am a size 10 and wear the large.  It is roomy and just the way I like it
review.name: Love the shirts!

review.reviewBody: The quality, fit, feel, and weight of these hoodies is stellar!  On a hot day, this is what I will reach for as the material is very light and soft, yet durable. I like the length as my low back or belly will not be exposed when I'm casting when fly fishing. Some women's tops fit everywhere but are tight across my upper back. The CLH, sz lrg, fits me perfectly. I don't like tops that are really tight. I have a little armpit room and a little bit of room to let the breeze flow through. I am 5'7", 158#, 38A chest, and 43" hips. I would have liked some different patterns and colors, but that's just a personal preference. I am very happy that there have been multiple colors of green. I typically think that men's outdoor tops have better color choices than women's but I think the CLH, overall, has been pretty good. Like others have written, the ties are annoying and the little pocket doesn't appear useful, but the ties can easily be trimmed off and I just forget about the pocket. The colors of the CLH's are accurate on the website. I highly recommend the CLH!!
review.name: These are my Favorite Warm Weather Hoodies!

review.reviewBody: Just as Happy with the Quality, Fit, and Feel as Previous CLH's! Like others, I'm not thrilled with the ties or tiny pocket, but it is super easy to get rid of the ties. I love this super thin and super soft material that still seems to be durable! For doing my warm weather outdoor activities, these are the best of the different brands of hoodies that I have. I am 5'7", 158#, chest 38A, hips 43" and the sz lrg fits me perfectly. I find that some tops are tight in the back across my shoulders and I have no problem here. I'm not in love with the current patterns of the CLH, but that's just an opinion. The colors are accurate. Highly recommend!
review.name: My Favorite Warm Weather Hoodie!

name: Crater Lake Long-Sleeve Hoodie - Women's

hasVariant.name: Jawbreaker Prizm Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Oakley Jawbreaker Prizm Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just got these and they are really nice, lightweight, look cool and function great!  You can adjust the arms in three lengths to fit any head type.  Also came with a smaller nose piece to further fine tune the glasses.  The locking design is really smart and probably the nicest paid of Oakley's I own (this is my ninth pair).
review.name: Great clarity and design

review.reviewBody:
I have used the Jawbreakers for a few years now and love them for mountain biking. I have the mountain bike and road bike lenses and typically use the mountain bike lens because they are so go in low light and still do well with the sun. The glasses have great coverage and keep any dirt, mud, water out of the eyes. Lens are very clear and have great coverage, but they are Oakley lenses, which are some of the best in the market but scratch easily. The glasses cover the full face and have a really good fit with adjustable arms. Lens swap system is easy and holds lens in securely. The frames are light weight and don't have the feel of much dexterity, but I have battle tested these and have had no issues with broken parts. They have great ventilation and don't fog up at all when on the move. I would highly recommend for Mountain Biking as the best on the market. 

I have recently started using for splitboarding with mixed results. When climbing, they fog up because you aren't going fast enough for the air to flow and clear the fog. That is true with all sunglasses I have tried though, as when sweat gets on the lens in cold weather, fog in inevitable. I still use these for skinning as the best option if have found. I have tried on the downhill a few times but when it's cold, the airflow freezes the eyes a bit so they are a no-go. These aren't intended for snow sports but just though I would share my experience.
review.name: Bike Sunglasses

name: Jawbreaker Prizm Sunglasses

review.name: Worth the money

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! They are toasty, stable, good traction, well-built, and have good arch support. The value was clear when I first wore them
review.name: Worth the money

review.reviewBody: wore these boots all winter long in northern Vermont, feet stayed warm and dry.
review.name: tough boots for tough winters

review.reviewBody: The upper on the boot is too tall and my socks do not come up high enough to keep the boot from rubbing my shin. The sole is soft and grippy, but it is so soft that the heels wear out too fast.
review.name: comfortable but not long lasting

review.reviewBody: I ordered size Ten but needed to get size 12 for a slip on effect. Boots are heavy clunkers that should last a life time.
review.name: As advertised!

review.reviewBody: I purchased 3 styles of Bogs sub zero temperature waterproof boots (including this one, for a trip inside the Arctic Circle to see the Northern lights. With proper layers of warm woolen and thermal socks, these Bogs boots kept our feet warm and dry for many hours each night. We were complimented several times by different guides for our choice in footwear.
review.name: Worked well inside the Arctic Circle in the dead of winter.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Great off and on work boot for chores or for a long trounce in the snow. I love slipping these on to head out to the chicken coop early in the morning.
review.name: Comfortable and sturdy.

review.reviewBody: Normally wear a size 13 boot. ordered these in 14 and they would NOT FIT. Wanted to order a 15 but not an option. Went to a different model boot and they work great
review.name: Too small for my big feet

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing bogs for the last 8 years at my job where waterproof boots are required PPE. These boots hold up to the constant wear of daily use. I recommend them highly, you won't regret it.
review.name: Best boots ever

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes, very well made and no flex.  Without question I can recommend these but.. just know that for me, the sizing runs small.  As an example, my size 44 Time shoes are pretty much the same as my size 11 running shoes.  However, I needed a size 45.5 in the Specialized Ares to fit.  It took me two pairs to figure out the sizing.  My recommendation is to measure the insoles of a pair of shoes that fit and then find the same measurement in these.
review.name: Great Shoes but Sizing Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
I ordered these shoes because I have bunions and needed a wide toe box. The interlacing of the Boa wires and the narrow heel made it virtually impossible for me to get them off and on.

They appear to be very well constructed. They were just not for me (sadly, because I used to live in Morgan Hill, CA, when the company was young, and I LOVE my S-Works Roubaix bike.
review.name: Almost impossible to get off and on

review.reviewBody: The product felt high quality and super light. easy to put on, but I had to return them. Even though the length of the shoe was great I felt my feet too tight in the shoe and uncomfortable. I never wear wide shoes and all my sneakers fit great so I do not know why this shoe is so tight. I hope if fit me well because for the sale price of 220 is unbeatable shoe.
review.name: Great product, strange fitting

review.reviewBody: Have used specialized shoes for 20+ years with great success, however this shoes fit does not measure up to prior versions. They are to narrow in the front (and I have narrow feet) and difficult to put on without a show horn as result of the built in sock. The BOA closure mechanism does not operate as smoothly as past designs.
review.name: Don't measure up to past designs

review.reviewBody: Despite following the sizing chart and getting the correct size, these shoes turned out to be far too small for me. I have never had to wear "wide" shoes, but these shoes made me feel like I must have monster feet. A few miles into their inaugural ride, I entirely loosened the front BOA to reduce the pressure on the front of my feet. Nevertheless, by the end of that ~60 mile ride, my left foot was swollen and numb for close to a week. For the price, I would expect at least a more accurate sizing chart. I have returned the shoes.
review.name: Far too narrow for normal feet

review.reviewBody: I did two 100-mile rides in these shoes with plenty of out-of-saddle climbing. They felt very light and stiff. The closure system felt great all along the tops of my feet and the length was perfect. Snug to get on with the sock liner but very secure once on. I had to return them though, because they were just a bit too narrow along the bone on the outside of my feet from heel to small toe. That side of my feet got very sore by the end of the ride. My feet measure 105 mm wide and 280 mm long using the Lake Shoe measuring system. I ordered 44.5 based on their chart. If you have narrower feet than I do these could be tremendous shoes, but they were too narrow for me.
review.name: Many nice features but not for wide feet

review.reviewBody:
I love this shoe. As others have written, they are by far the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn (and I have a bit of a cycling shoe thing). That would be great, but they are also excellent fitting and provide high performance. You don't need to tighten them much... just snugging them down gives excellent feel and control. 

The "not perfect" comes from the sock liner. I have the white shoes, and the liner (particularly at the instep) turned grey very quickly from dirt, and doesn't seem to be cleanable. The rest of the shoe looks great, but the liner... not so much. I'm still seeking a way to clean them.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody:
Let me start by saying that I'm a long time fan of S-works shoes. I currently rotate through the Sub6 (lace up), Exos (one BOA dial) and now these which are by far the most comfortable. On the hottest days here in Texas, there is no beating the Exos and for style, the Sub6 hit the mark. But these Ares are SOOOOO stinkin' comfortable that I choose them most often. There is also some magic with the stiffer sole that makes them feel super connected to the pedal; like every watt is getting transmitted directly to the pedal. I love the new BOA dials that you can turn to tighten or loosen one micro notch at a time or pop them up to instantly get them off your feet. 
One note on the size: I always wear a 45 in S-Works shoes and these seam just a hair larger than the other, but still fit fine. Maybe if you're in between sizes then size down. 
I agree with other reviewers that the looks are funky, BUT...I don't care. I'll take function over form in this situation. 
The cost is a little embarrassing to admit to anyone so I gloss over that bit when people ask, but I'll wear holes in my kit, wear out my chain and use no name water bottles to put extra money towards shoes like this.
review.name: Fantastic fit, super stiff soles!

review.reviewBody: I decided to go with these shoes because they were rated most comfortable in a number of reviews. Given that "comfortable" in this context is a rather relative term, I must agree: I have ridden about 600 miles in the shoes and I like them very much. The wide toe cage is a major plus for me and the fit is spot on. The double BOA system is great and allows minute adjustments. So far the have aged very well.
review.name: Nice Shoes

review.reviewBody: I?ve tried many brands and types. I finally found my feet soulmates. Not kidding. These shoes are amazing fit and comfort.
review.name: Best shoes ever

name: S-Works Ares Road Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my kids to use for this years deer and elk hunt and they loved them.  We hunted about 14 days and they never complained about their feet.
review.name: Kids loved them.

review.itemreviewed: Breeze AT Ultradry Hiking Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: My son thinks these boots are great! He wears them in the snow and hiking around the mountains/desert. He wears them all day without any complaining.
review.name: Great for Snow and Hiking
comment: Thank you for your stellar review! I am glad to hear your sons Vasque's continue to bring lasting comfortability, and they work well for his day to day. We hope to continue to serve you!

review.itemreviewed: Breeze AT Ultradry Hiking Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: My daughter loves that they don’t pinch her feet and they stay dry in river beds and creek spelunking. They’re stylish and easy to get on and off. The little loop in the back is especially helpful pulling feet out.
review.name: My kid loves these!

review.itemreviewed: Breeze AT Ultradry Hiking Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: They lasted exactly one gentle 3-mile walk around a lake near our house on pavement for our 7 year old before they started coming apart at the seems on the top of the shoe. I'd return them except my experience with BC's return policy and no equivalent replacement in stock...and more importantly, the heartbreak of a 7 year old who was just looking to go "creek stomping" being without. For the price and rep of the company, I'd have expected much better quality.
review.name: Look and seem of great quality, but...

name: Breeze AT Ultradry Hiking Boot - Kids'

review.reviewBody: wanted lighter rechargeable nheadlamp for my wife's travel kit.
review.name: Head Lamp

review.reviewBody: As a professional naturalist guide (for over 25 years), it's important to be prepared and well-equipped on all of the trips I lead and personal trips too. I'm excited about using this on the trail as my headlamp I carry on all of my day hiking trips and especially on backpacking trips. It is lightweight, compact and has a powerful beam that is dimmable. Having a red light option and the ability to lock the light in the off position were selling points for me as well. I've been looking for a high quality headlamp and I believe this one fits the bill!
review.name: Lightweight and Powerful

review.reviewBody: Headlamp is comfortable. Illumination perfect for my evening walks.
review.name: Great headlamp

review.reviewBody: I've had several generations of Spot headlamps. This one is well engineered, comfortable, easy to use, and the rechargeability is nice.
review.name: Improvement over older versions of Spot headlamp

review.reviewBody: Works well, bright, easy to use, easy to charge, lightweight.
review.name: Nice light

review.reviewBody: Great headlamp. Does what it should and then some.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
I use it in the woods to lightly illuminate my trail. With the dimmable red light beam I can walk in safely, without spooking the animals, and still see clearly. The white light beam, when needed, is marvelous.

Don N.
review.name: Great for hunters.

review.reviewBody: Love the rechargeable and all the many features! Thanks BD
review.name: Cats meow

review.reviewBody: I really like these-- super comfy pants thst fit well even for a curvier body. I love my jogger sweats but you can't dress them up. These are really versatile- you can wear them with sneakers for a hike, or dress them up for work, with cute boots and a nice top. I only wish the fabric was a bit thicker. I've only washed and worn them a couple of times (still good), but I can't imagine them having much longevity.
review.name: Thin fabric, but comfy and cute

review.reviewBody: I love these pants.  Just got my second pair.  They are comfortable, and wash and dry quickly
review.name: Second pair

review.reviewBody: I have these in every color!  They are my favorite pants!  I initially got them for outdoor activities but love them so much I use them for every day as well!
review.name: My favorite pants!!

review.reviewBody: Title says it all. Have been rocking these for years.
review.name: The absolute best hiking pants

review.reviewBody: I adore these pants.  Perfect fit and super cozy for early morning bike rides.  I do with they came in brighter colours though.   Also, an option to have a longer leg would help my ankles stay warm too.
review.name: Perfect for everything

review.reviewBody: These were going to be my favorite pants. I bought 2 pairs because my hopes were so high! Right out of the packaging I was amazed at how well they fit, the light but stretchy material, and the pockets. I have gone rock climbing in these pants twice for each pair. The first pair has pilling on the butt where the back straps of my harness were moving along the fabric. My second pair has a hope ripped in the inner leg (which I have already sent a claim to MH for a repair) but also has pilling in the front crotch area from where my harness had rubbed. I bought a 3rd pair of the full length pants to use for hiking and I am so worried about the inner thigh pilling I will experience after wearing them and hiking. My pants look like they’ve been used for years and they’ve only been worn twice. Please please use better fabric, more durable. Mountain Hardware clothing should stand up to hard wear, not be this delicate!
review.name: Not for any actual physical activity

review.reviewBody: These are my perfect, go-to pants for summer! The 2 zip pockets on the side make all the difference!  Keys, wallet, phone, epipen--all secure! The hi rise is low enough to be comfortable and keep the pants from slipping down, even when I'm most active--and the overall stretch makes every activity easy.  Just right for me--i would trade all my other summer pants for some more of these!
review.name: Perfect pants!

review.reviewBody: I have 10 different colors. Great for curvy figures. Love the zipper pockets.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants--in fact, I wish I had discovered them before I bought so many pairs of the regular Dynama 2 ankle pants (which used to be my favorite pants)! Why? Because they have TWO functional front zip pockets (instead of one small one) -- which are big enough for keys and a cell phone and even an Epipen! Wish I could trade now! The waist is still comfortable, though a bit higher.  I love them!!
review.name: My new favorite pants!

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’4” and these pants fit more like regular pants than ankle pants but that’s absolutely fine.  I appreciate that they’re roomy enough in the hip without gapping at the waist.  This is my 4th pair and I love the new grey colour!  Don’t change a thing except for a new colour now and then!
review.name: My favourite summer hiking pant!

name: Dynama High Rise Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Selle SMP Well Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Replaced a stock seat from Specialized with this. So much more comfortable on longer rides.
review.name: Great Seat

review.reviewBody: I had the  SMP dynamic years ago and really loved it except I had some saddlesore issues I couldn’t resolve and had to get rid of it. So I decided to try this one and so far so good SMP saddles are by far the best design in my opinion, but set up is tricky. You really have to fidget so plan on that if you’re getting one and generally speaking, it seems like you need to run them farther forward than you would think especially if you measure. what I like about this saddle is it’s more padded than the pro line so it’s good for a rider who is now riding one hour a day versus the four and five I used to do .
review.name: Selle smp well

review.reviewBody: After 5 rides, this saddle is a great fit for me! Previously used a Specialized Power and found myself re-positioning ever few miles. Not with the SMP, very comfortable and keeps me centered. Padding is just right and can ride without minimal padding. I’m 6’ and 62. Happy Ridding!
review.name: One Slice

name: Well Saddle

review.reviewBody: These are my absolute favorite shoes! Comfortable and lightweight. Looks good with just about everything I wear. Love them!!
review.name: Loyak

review.reviewBody: I have TOO MANY loyaks because I love them so much. Also because I lost the left one on my second pair when I swam one day. They are form fitting so I can smoosh my giant feet into my tiny kayak plus they’re comfy and I wear them to work and to the river. 👏🏼
review.name: Love ‘em! Can’t stop buyin’em!

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of Loyaks about 5 years ago for kayaking but didn’t like my feet being soggy so stuck with flip flops. After spending too much money on Sperry’s, Helly Hanson, Addidas over the years for sailing shoes that all lost their grip after a few months of wear, I used my old Loyaks for the past two months of sailing on our new boat. I was confident in their grip on wet (and dry!) decks, I could feel the deck level anchor controls with my toes, my shoes didn’t get caught in lines as I stepped over them, no pain or damage to my toes when I kicked deck hardware by mistake, no pressure on my bunion, I felt like an eight year old climbing on railings, no sweaty feet, I can wear them with or without socks and it’s really like being barefoot but with protection! I just purchased the all weather Loyaks for myself and a pair of the originals for my husband for Christmas. I’ve always liked Astral, now I LOVE Astral! Thanks for making a great functional and attractive shoe!
review.name: Best sailing shoe

review.reviewBody: As a size11, this helps keep foot size manageable in kayak.  Then can scamper over rocks and sand without issue. Keeps muck away from my feet at certain launch sites. Had first pair for 2 years then lost them. No second guessing of what to replace with.
review.name: Purchased Twice!!

review.reviewBody: Great shoes! Tad tight on top of foot, but they are great for indoor and outdoor. I work in a relatively wet and cold environment but these are breathable without restriction. If you’re new to barefoot shoes these are probably gonna be the best gateway shoes to adjust your gait.
review.name: Little tight on top but great shoes. No complaint

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th pair of Loyak W's. I discovered this water shoes when I began my kayak outfitting business 5 years ago, and I have been thrilled with them. Due to heavy use, I eventually wear through the soles of each pair, but apart from that natural wear and some sun fading, they look and function as well on their retirement day as on day one. I rinse them off with clean water at the end of each day, and that has kept them from getting any funky smells. I also receive compliments on them regularly. Water shoes that function perfectly AND get compliments? Pretty rare.
review.name: My 5th pair!

review.reviewBody: Beautiful, comfortable and versatile- what more could you want?!
review.name: These go with everything!

review.reviewBody: Astral shoes are always great shoes at a nice price. This is my 4th pair!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I bought a size 8 (usually wear 8.5 but no half sizes) and it fit great! Comfortable, cute, and great non-slip sole on river rocks, even algae covered ones. Also comfortable for wearing off the river.
review.name: Great water shoe

name: Loyak Water Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This design with a cup holder on the outside (what?) has less packing room inside than my old simple one from Dakine. The mesh compartment just displaces room you could use if it wasn’t there - why do you need to separate your clothes? I used it for a 2week Italy trip and didn’t over pack but this seemed awkward every time I zipped it shut. Why do you need split level? Straps?? Weird. Rolled nicely on the big wheels but again those were overkill. It could use over snow wheels… that’d be something!
review.name: Dakine overengineered this one

review.reviewBody:
This has been an outstanding carry on roller bag.  The main compartment has a split design.  One side has compression straps and the other has a full length zippered mesh cover.  On an 11 day trip to Europe I packed dress shoes, toiletry kit, fleece full zip jacket and other items in the open side.  I used the side with the zippered mesh cover as a large built-in packing cube.  This is where I packed all of my clothing including four pairs of lightweight pants, four long sleeve shirts, undershirts and folded sport coat in the side with the mesh cover.  On the front there is a sleeve for a laptop which fit my 13" no problem.  I did not need to use the expansion capability, but it was peace of mind to have it and not need it.

The large caster style wheels worked well for rolling over cobblestone streets and sidewalks.  I bought the black Vx21 version and it proved to be water proof.  It rained during the trip, and while the outside got very wet, everything inside was dry.  The size was just right for easily fitting into airplane overhead bins and it did not take up too much space on the trains and subways.

One item that should be obvious is that due to the split design it can be awkward to access the main areas while on a hotel luggage rack. It's the one trade off of the split design vs clamshell luggage, but I prefer the built-in organization of the split design.  All in all I'm very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Light & built in organization!

review.reviewBody: This thing is perfect for my constant travels to Colorado! Plenty of space for my necessities and fits in thr overhead just perfectly. Super pleased
review.name: Love!

name: Status 42L+ Roller Bag

review.reviewBody: This was my first Marmot purchase. Thought I was getting a steal. Nope. Got a lemon. It’s HUGE. I read the reviews and ratings that it was true to fit. Not. My size Large is really like a 2XL and I bought a final sale. What’s worse was that I reached out to Backcountry for help and they said no exceptions. So now I will not buy from Backcountry any more. I can’t do anything with this sweater. It’s TOO BIG. Super disappointed.

review.reviewBody:
Beautiful Color. And who doesn't like Marmot?

I ordered a large because I wanted it to fit comfortably over sweaters and stuff. Also, I have a very large chest. The large was perfect because the length of the arms is not too long. Nor is the length of the jacket itself too long, just past my waist.

review.reviewBody: Good lightweight cap. Would fit well into a pack. The brim stays pretty straight so it won’t bend at a weird angle in a pack. It’s also comfortable to wear. My only complaint so far is that the free end of the sizing strap is a bit short. If you have a big head, the free end may hang loose rather than staying tucked into the side of the cap.
review.name: Nice packable trail hat

review.reviewBody: This cap is very versatile, as it both is warming and cooling. I use it for active pursuits (running, hiking) and casual alike. It is very lightweight and fits well (I have a large head). I have received compliments on the hat, although I really don't care too much about that sort of thing.
review.name: Great lid for many occassions

review.reviewBody: Haven't had opportunity to prove freeing weather warmth. From a cold morning start to the mid 60's at mid day I was kept warm in the cold and did not experience overheating as the day warmed. Very comfortable while active as well as resting.
review.name: As designed

review.reviewBody: Love the fabric and feel of this cap. Lightweight and breathable, holds a little heat in cool weather. It is one size fits all, and while I forced adjustment with the plastic connector at back and succeeded in making the band size smaller, the body of the cap itself is still a bit too large, so it bags a bit and since it is short, it rides up on my head unless I anchor it with a ponytail. That all said, it's become my go-to cap. Prefer it to cotton standbys.
review.name: Great hat but please tidy up the fit

review.reviewBody: Warm, yet breathable - the perfect hat for those early spring jaunts up the hill!
review.name: Perfect Hat for Spring Ski Touring

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this hat. It's light weight and breakable. The material is very soft and well made. I will be buying more in other colors.
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: Super pleased with my Trail Mix Hat!! Amazing quality, fast shipping and great service!! Worn it everyday!!
review.name: Stoked with my purchase!!!!

review.reviewBody: Love my Trail Mix Cap. I wear it around the house, on tours, on approaches to ice climbs. It's warm and quick drying, perfect for going around town or getting outside.
review.name: Cozy hat that performs as good as it looks

review.reviewBody: The Trail Mix Cap fits well, is comfortable, and definitely warmer than the OR Swift Cap, another favorite of mine. No water resistance, but seems to dry quickly after a rain.
review.name: Comfortable warmth

review.reviewBody: This hat is perfect for almost all climates and when sleeping in a poorly heated cabin . I have gone on many trips with no other cap.
review.name: My hat is off to OR for this one.

review.reviewBody:
Ordered a half size up as recommended by some reviews, but it was too loose to get a good control of the toe box and confidently smear.
I would go with my normal size the next time.
review.name: Go with ur normal size

review.reviewBody: The shoes have very good grip on wet rocks and great for rock scramble types of hiking however compared to regular hiking shoes, the soles do not have enough support for hiking beyond about 5miles so after that the bottom of your feet will start to hurt on rocky terrain but I think it will still be fine on dirt trails.
review.name: Good approach shoes

review.reviewBody:
I ordered these for hiking and climbing approaches. Tested them out over the weekend at Linnville Gorge and I have to say they felt secure and were very versatile for on and off trail hiking. We covered some hard terrain and I felt confident moving around in these. 

Note, they do run small. I had to return and order a 1/2 size up. They are supposed to be tight so I think I'll need to find some lighter-weight socks. Excited to continue trying these out on upcoming adventures.
review.name: Great overall approach shoes

review.reviewBody: I have an older pair of the TX2 approach shoes and they fit like a glove. Ordered this new version and they are insanely narrow. I matched the soles of the new version to the old version (both are size 40) and La Sportiva has cut 1/3 to 1/2 inch off the width. So these will only fit narrow width feet now. I am not going to order the next size up because that is not going to fix how narrow these shoes are. Since I am an ordinary mortal, I will be looking for a different brand of approach shoes.
review.name: For narrow width feet only

review.reviewBody: I bought these for climbing my local Via Ferrata. I was pleasantly surprised how comfortable they were and I didn't have any issues with slippage in the heel. They smeared nicely on the rock and were more supportive than I thought they would be since the upper is like a stretchy sock.The fit is fairly close to my TX4's which I love, but these are more breathable. The sole is flat with no raised heel unlike the TX4's, but it didn't make much of a difference in performance.  I did go up a half size from my TX4's.  I might be buying a second pair!
review.name: Like wearing house slippers

review.reviewBody: I have a really hard time finding a good fit in approach shoes - these are the perfect balance between an athletic shoe fit and climbing shoe fit. Outstanding grip on rocky approaches, easy on and off while climbing, secure footing on low angle leading. I love them!
review.name: Perfect Approach Shoe!

name: TX2 Evo Approach Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I like the style and fit but the pockets are too small and the zippers are scratchy and sharp metal. That’s a big problem for me.
review.name: Good style, bad zippers and pockets

review.reviewBody: Great collar to seal out the cold. Mid weight insulation. Tough durable material.
review.name: Warm mid weight jacket

review.reviewBody:
I love them. Bought them for my construction crew. Really a good look & super durable.

They block 100% of the wind.

They aren't waterproof. It'd be nice if they came with some kind of waterproofing applied to the canvas. 

Overall I love them.
review.name: I bought... 2 and then 8 more!

review.reviewBody: I've had this for about two years and I have loved it.  It is rugged both in materials and in looks and warm enough that last year it was my main winter coat (I live in the Northeast).  It doesn't really repel water but I've worn it in light rain and snow and as long as you're not out long it will not soak through.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy this.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody:
Complete junk. Looks great but was completely demolished upon one wash, following instructions and all. The dye fades in splotches, especially on any crease area. Also the pockets are tiny, like kid size tiny. 


Just threw away $150
review.name: Save your $

name: Burr Lined Jacket - Men's
